security: Disclosing details of planned congressional inspections of CIA covert intelligence sites could strain relationships with friendly foreign intelligence services, as it risks a 'discontinuance of agreements between CIA and some of the friendly foreign intelligence services.'
summary: This memorandum discusses Senator Walter Mondale's planned trip to inspect CIA covert intelligence sites in Europe, the concerns it raised with the White House, and a briefing for the SSC on how National Intelligence Estimates are prepared.
summary_one_paragraph: A memorandum to Mr. W. R. Wannall regarding 'Senstudy 75' (62-116395) addresses Senator Walter Mondale's intention to inspect CIA covert intelligence sites in Europe, which caused concern at the White House due to potential strain on relationships with foreign intelligence services; it also mentions a planned detailed briefing for the SSC (Senate Select Committee) by Mr. Colby on the preparation of National Intelligence Estimates by the United States Intelligence Board for the NSC, including the participation of several senior officials of the Intelligence Community Staff.
title: Senstudy 75 - SSC Foreign Travel and National Intelligence Estimates
